intro: Behuria mourae var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed behuria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rounded, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
